result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Verlon Terrell Allen Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Verlon Terrell Allen Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Erica N Young appeared by video for Verlon Terrell Allen Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel is recently appointed and still needs offer and discovery.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Verlon Terrell Allen Jr appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Order to Show Cause Hearing held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Public defenders office notified court by email that they will have counsel appointed by next court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Verlon Terrell Allen Jr appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court will order case scheduled for State v. Lee Hearing.  Public defenders office emailed of next court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Verlon Terrell Allen in court.  Josh Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Verlon Terrell Allen in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with CAH
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Verlon Terrell Allen in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Verlon Terrell Allen in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Verlon Terrell Allen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
